metadata.title: Volunteers across America help those in need so no one goes hungry this Thanksgiving
metadata.author: ABC News

transcript: Finally tonight here, one week until Thanksgiving. The remarkable effort now spreading across the country to put special medically tailored meals on the table. Here's Deborah Roberts. Tonight, with Thanksgiving just a week away, the extraordinary effort from so many all across the US to feed those in need. Welcome to the Gods Love Kitchen. This is a huge kitchen. It is huge. And it smells great, too, by the way. Amazing. In New York City, the nonprofit God's Love We Deliver for 40 years now since 1985, cooking and delivering special medically tailored meals and so much more. Terrence Mech, once a volunteer, is president and CEO. They're not alone at the end of the day, and that they have the dignity that they deserve, the love, compassion that we do here at God's Deliver. It's life-changing. You bring the connection. We do right to their door. An incredible 20,000 volunteers making 4 million meals a year. You're good at that. Very well done. Aurora decorating the cakes. Volunteering here for 6 years now. I just like the the feeling that I'm doing something for somebody that I don't actually know, but I feel that I know them. This Thanksgiving, more than a,000 volunteers cooking and delivering 12,500 dinners. That's 8,300 lb of turkey. Andy slicing. This is our bee and spinach stew. Lead sue chef Brian making soups. The veggies. Topping it all off with gravy. Robert adding the stuffing. Feline peeling potatoes. You're not just delivering food. You're bringing so much more to these folks. Yes. What I gave to God is so I got so much more. And they're not alone. Their model now expanding through the food is medicine coalition. The nonprofits Mama's Kitchen in San Diego, OpenHand Atlanta in Georgia, and Project Angel Heart in Denver. All delivering meals this Thanksgiving. Carry up those meals, give them that hug, say happy Thanksgiving. And it's the best. It's just the best. You're changing lives on both sides. We are. We are. It's changed my life. And I'm so grateful. No question. To help, go to God's Love We Deliver website, gl.org.

key_facts: Thanksgiving is one week away.
God's Love We Deliver is a nonprofit organization founded in 1985.
The organization has been providing medically tailored meals for 40 years.
God's Love We Deliver operates a large kitchen in New York City.
The kitchen smells great and is described as huge.
Terrence Mech is the current president and CEO of God's Love We Deliver.
Terrence Mech was once a volunteer with the organization.
The organization delivers meals directly to people's doors.
Volunteers at God's Love We Deliver include Aurora, Andy, Brian, Robert, and Feline.
Aurora has volunteered at the kitchen for six years.
Aurora volunteers because she feels connected to people she doesn't know.
This Thanksgiving, over 1,000 volunteers are involved in cooking and delivering meals.
The organization will deliver 12,500 dinners during this Thanksgiving.
The total weight of turkey delivered is 8,300 pounds.
The meals are medically tailored to meet specific dietary needs.
The organization serves people who are often isolated or homebound.
The model of food as medicine is expanding through the Food is Medicine Coalition.
Mama's Kitchen in San Diego is part of the coalition.
OpenHand Atlanta in Georgia is part of the coalition.
Project Angel Heart in Denver is part of the coalition.
All three organizations are delivering meals this Thanksgiving.
Volunteers carry meals and offer hugs and well-wishes.
The experience is described as life-changing for both recipients and volunteers.
The organization emphasizes dignity, love, and compassion in its mission.
The website gl.org provides information on how to help
key_opinions: The kitchen is huge and smells amazing.
The work done by God's Love We Deliver is life-changing.
Volunteering brings a deep sense of connection and purpose.
The meal delivery process is more than just food—it’s emotional support.
The volunteers feel they receive as much as they give.
The model of food as medicine is powerful and impactful.
The Thanksgiving effort is the best thing about the season.
The organization’s mission changes lives on both sides.
The volunteers’ efforts are deeply meaningful and fulfilling.
The gratitude expressed by participants is genuine and profound
key_datapoints: One bee and spinach stew prepared
Gravy is served as a topping
